item.title: Trinity add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "When you are five, you know your age down to the month. Even in your twenties, you know how old you are. I'm twenty-three you say, or maybe twenty-seven. But then in your thirties, something strange starts to happen. It is a mere hiccup at first, an instant of hesitation. How old are you? Oh, I'm--you start confidently, but then you stop. You were going to say thirty-three, but you are not. You're thirty-five. And then you're bothered, because you wonder if this is the beginning of the end. It is, of course, but it's decades before you admit it." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "Dear God. Not only am I unemployed and homeless, but I also have a pregnant woman, bereaved dog, elephant, and eleven horses to take care of." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Rob Lowe
item.description: "So I came to the realization: Nothing in life is unfair. It's just life." -- Rob Lowe

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "French name, English accent, American school. Anna confused." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
Trinity add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Seriously, I don't know any American girl who can resist an English accent." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "People should say what they mean and not make other people stumble around." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "So do you believe in second chances?" I bite my lip. "Second, third, fourth. Whatever it takes. However long it takes. If the person is right," he adds. "If the person is... Lola?" This time, he holds my gaze. "Only if the other person is Cricket." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Girl scouts didn't teach me what to do with emotionally unstable drunk boys." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Anthony Rapp
item.description: "Labels are for cans, not people." -- Anthony Rapp

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Anthony Rapp
item.description: "Grief does not expire like a candle or the beacon on a lighthouse. It simply changes temperature." -- Anthony Rapp

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Kristin Chenoweth
item.description: "I'm sick of people who've never been to church telling me that church is full of hypocrites, and people who've never read the Bible telling me that it's baloney." -- Kristin Chenoweth

item.title: Trinity add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I told Augustus the broad outline of my miracle: diagnosed with Stage IV thyroid cancer when I was thirteen. (I didn’t tell him that the diagnosis came three months after I got my first period. Like: Congratulations! You’re a woman. Now die.)" -- John Green

item.title: Trinity add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Veronica Roth
Trinity add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Showing gratitude is one of the simplest yet most powerful things humans can do for each other." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Remember, we're madly in love, so it's all right to kiss me anytime you feel like it." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "He kisses me again, more insistent this time, his hands squeezing my waist. His breaths, his body, my body, we are so close there is no difference." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "Got that gun?” Peter says to Tobias. “No,” says Tobias, “I figured I would shoot the bullets out of my nostrils, so I left it upstairs." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "Sleep,” he says. “I'll fight the bad dreams off if they come to get you.” “With what?” “My bare hands, obviously." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "He slides his hand over my cheek, one finger anchored behind my ear. Then he tilts his head down and kisses me, sending a warm ache through my body. I wrap my hands around his arm, holding him there as long as I can. When he touches me, the hollowed-out feeling in my chest and stomach is not as noticeable." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "We're all right, you know,' he says quietly. 'You and me. Okay?' My chest aches, and I nod. 'Nothing else is all right.' His whisper tickles my cheek. 'But we are." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "...this is exactly the kind of store that makes you want to buy a book about a teenage wizard. This is the kind of store that makes you want to <i>be</i> a teenage wizard." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "If this sounds impressive to you, you’re over thirty." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Trinity add a quote by Shauna Niequist
item.description: "I know now that I can make it through more than I thought, with less than I thought. I know better than to believe that the changes are over, and I know better than to believe the next ones will be easier, but I've learned the hard way that change is one of God's greatest gifts and one of his most useful tools." -- Shauna Niequist
